priorVersion.title: CDISC SEND Planned Pharmacologic Target Mode of Action Response Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C154684

self.title: CDISC SEND Planned Pharmacologic Target Mode of Action Response Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the functional change at the level of the intended target of the pharmacologic intervention.
name: Planned Pharmacologic Target Mode of Action Response
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Planned Pharmacologic Target Mode of Action Response Terminology
synonyms: Planned Pharmacologic Target Mode of Action Response

terms.definition: A class of substances that binds to, activates and increases the activity of a molecular target.
A class of substances that binds to and acts as a full or partial agonist at one receptor and an antagonist at another.
A class of substances that binds to a molecular target allosterically and induces a conformational change in the target. This leads to an altered binding affinity of the target to its substrate.

A class of substances that binds to a molecular target allosterically and induces a conformational change in that target. This leads to an enhanced binding affinity of the target to its substrate, and thereby amplifies the effect of the substrate on that target.
A class of substances that binds to and activates a receptor and is intended to induce the maximum biological response.
A class of substances that binds to and inhibits the function or activity of a molecular target.
A class of substances that binds to a receptor at the same binding site as an agonist, but induces a biological response opposite to that agonist.
A class of substances that irreversibly and permanently binds to and decreases the activity of and/or deactivates a target.
A class of substances that binds to and activates a receptor with less efficacy, and produces submaximal receptor activation relative to a full agonist.
A class of substances that binds to and activates a receptor and produces a biological effect which inhibits or negates the biological response produced by an agonist at a different receptor.
A class of substances that binds to and activates a receptor and induces a biological response.
A class of substances that competitively, noncompetitively or allosterically binds to and inhibits receptor activity.
